title: Requiring Coronavirus Disease 2019 Vaccination for Federal Employees

enrichment.summary: This executive order requires all federal employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to protect their health and the health of the public they serve. Agencies must implement vaccination programs with exceptions only as required by law, based on guidance from the Safer Federal Workforce Task Force.
potential_concerns: Mandating COVID-19 vaccination may create compliance challenges and potential job security risks for federal employees who have medical, religious, or personal objections, impacting workforce morale and retention.
Implementation of the vaccine requirement could lead to administrative burdens and legal challenges for agencies managing exemptions and enforcement, potentially delaying agency operations.

Some federal employees may experience unintended negative health outcomes or distrust toward the federal workforce management due to perceived coercion or insufficient accommodation, possibly affecting productivity.

The executive order may disproportionately impact subpopulations within the federal workforce who have historically lower vaccination rates, raising concerns about equity and targeted support measures.
